intro: Randia nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Randia nelsonii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
